message: Looking into it - thanks Brad

File "/mnt/bundles/port-8030/app_image/pyenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 180, in _send
    self.connect()
  File "/mnt/bundles/port-8030/app_image/pyenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/redis/connection.py", line 127, in connect
    raise ConnectionError(self._error_message(e))
ConnectionError: Error 111 connecting db-runner01.gb1.ep.io:9006. ECONNREFUSED.
Getting that error when executing celery tasks

I tried turning it off and on again (re-upload) and still getting the same issue. I noticed if I run my own celeryd from the commandline (i.e. epio django celeryd) it is trying to connect on a different port (and seems to succeed) - redis://guest@db-runner01.gb1.ep.io:9627/
Sorry, I was being brain-dead and uploading the wrong app. Seems to have corrected it by re-uploading. Have added a check on queue function to my pingdom checks to see if it happens again...
Obviously, the workers are supposed to detect this, but that code isn't quite done yet (in an ideal world, of course, Redis doesn't die)
explains why a re-upload fixed it
@bradwhittington I suspect what happened is that your redis server died while the worker was running - the workers don't detect this and just keep on trundling
would have prompted the redis server to try starting again
I'll go see if I can get that worker-detecting-dead-services code working

Seems like there are issues with celery again. Seems to be putting onto the queue fine, but no celery workers seem to be able to connect: [2011-07-18 12:07:57,654: ERROR/MainProcess] [1;31mConsumer: Connection Error: Error 111 connecting db-runner01.gb1.ep.io:9908. Connection refused.. Trying again in 32 seconds...[0m
@bradwhittington Sorry, it seems I told to forget to tell Ben to check Convore while I was away; is this still an issue?
thanks.
@andrewgodwin It disappeared with https://convore.com/epio/anybody-else-having-trouble-uploading-new-apps/
(name or numeric ID, either is fine)
@bradwhittington Hmm, alright. What was the app ID?
Oh, disappeared as in, came right, corrected itself.
@bradwhittington Oh, excellent! That's better news that I expected.
